title: Premier League : What are Arsenal and Man City remaining fixtures ? | Football
body_text:
Manchester City regained top spot in the Premier League following their 3-0 win over West Ham at the Etihad on Wednesday night.
Arsenal themselves had briefly returned to the league summit following their vital 3-1 victory over Chelsea on Tuesday.
The Gunners have been the pace setters for much of the season but four successive games without a win in April saw them relinquish the advantage to Manchester City.
Pep Guardiola’s men are currently one point ahead of the Londoners with one game in hand.
Here are the remaining Premier League fixtures this season for both Arsenal and Manchester City.
Arsenal’s remaining fixtures
Arsenal’s next game sees them head to St James’ Park to face a Newcastle side who have only lost once at home all season, with Eddie Howe’s men chasing a spot in the Champions League for the first time since 2002.

Their fixture after that is a home match against another side hot in the pursuit of European football – Brighton.
Arsenal will hope Nottingham Forest’s Premier League status is confirmed one way or another by the time they travel to the City Ground in their penultimate game, whilst they will also be eager for Wolves to have nothing to play for on the final day of the season when the Midlanders make the trip to the Emirates.
Arsenal's remaining fixtures
- Newcastle (A) – May 7
- Brighton (H) – May 14
- Nottingham Forest (A) – May 20
- Wolves (H) – May 28
Manchester City’s remaining fixtures
While Arsenal have their focus solely on the Premier League, Manchester City’s hunt for their third consecutive league title could be complicated by their continued involvement in the Champions League.
Pep Guardiola’s side beat Bayern Munich in the quarter-finals to secure progression to the semi-finals, where they will face current holders Real Madrid in the last four.
The two legs against the Spanish giants will take place on May 9 and May 17, right in the midst of their final Premier League fixtures.
They have also secured a spot in the FA Cup final against Manchester United, but that game will be played on June 3, after the final day of the Premier League on May 28.
More Trending
As for the final run of games in the league, City have home fixtures with Leeds and Chelsea – both of which look straightforward on paper at least.
They will also take a trip to Everton, while potential banana skins await in their visits to Brighton and then Brentford on the final day.
The long journey down to face Brighton in their game in hand looks particularly troublesome, with Guardiola describing Roberto De Zerbi’s side as ‘the best team in the world’ at building up from the back.
City are specialists in holding their nerve in the business end of the season, collecting 145 points in the final ten games of the previous six campaigns combined – more than any other team in the league.
Manchester City remaining fixtures
- Leeds (H) – May 7
- Champions League semi-final: Real Madrid (A) – May 9
- Everton (A) – May 14
- Champions League semi-final: Real Madrid (H) – May 17
- Chelsea (H) – May 20
- Brighton (A) – May 24
- Brentford (A) – May 28
- FA Cup final: Manchester United – June 3
- Potential Champions League final – June 10
